text: <!here|@here> does anyone have a bike shop they’d recommend for tunes/general maintenance? I’ve yet to find one in town that deserves my loyalty. Bonus points if they’d know their way around a 20+ y/o touring bike :bike:
I’m willing to drive somewhere for a good spot
I like Cyclepath on MLK (and Russel-ish?). But I’ve never had maintenance done, just buying parts and always talking to the same cool guy. Kinda pricey I think though.
Abraham Fixes Bikes on Williams and Fremont is affordable but I can’t say the service I got was anything more than average. Ok but not incredible.
hahah I always hated that place
I hear Joel’s garage is nice
but that was awhile ago, could definitely have improved since
I’m family friends with the guy who runs Seven Corners Cycles and think it’s a great place. He knows all his customers by name and does awesome work. I just bought a bike from there
I can attest :point_up:. Knows all customers and does awesome work
Actually it’s just because Elise told me about it
I go to Cat Six on 42nd. Super nice people and have been speedy and solid in the minor stuff I’ve needed: <http://www.catsixcycles.com/>

attachments.title: About
attachments.text: NE Portland bike shop focused on families and commuters. New bicycle sales and full-service repair. On 42nd Ave serving the Beaumont-Wilshire, Concordia, and Cully neighborhoods.

text: whoa they even have a cat on staff
I had a great experience purchasing at Sellwood Cycle
oh yeah I forgot about Sellwood Cycle! That is where I bought my bike in the first place...
